hello I'm Kunal a cloud support engineer
at the AWS office in Northern Virginia
today I'm going to demonstrate how to
install and enable the Apple repository
on Amazon Linux red hat and Centos
Amazon elastic compute Cloud instances
when the packages aren't available in
standard repositories let's get started
plug into the AWS Management console as
you can see I have already launched S2
instances using Amazon Linux sent to S7
Centos 8 Red Hat 7 Red at 8. correctly
configure the security groups that are
necessary to communicate with the EPL
repo
use SSH to connect to instance then run
the following command to verify the
distribution
this is an Amazon Linux 2 system
after the distribution is verified you
can enable the Apple repository for that
distribution let me show you how to
enable this in the different
distributions
install the Apple release package and
then enable the Apple repository on
Amazon Linux 2.
install the Apple release package for ad
hat 8.
install and enable the Apple release
package for Red Hat 7.
this is a red hat 7 system
install the EPL release package for
Saint OS 8 enable both the apple and
power tools repositories note that the
power tools repository contains
development tools required by many Apple
packages
as we can see this is sentos 8.
install and enable the EPL release
package on Centos 7. note that sent to
S7 includes the Apple release package in
the base repositories
as we can see this is sent to S7
now to verify that Apple repository is
enabled run the following command
so now you know how to install and
enable the Apple repository on Amazon
Linux red hat and sent OS Amazon elastic
compute Cloud instances when the
packages aren't available in standard
repositories
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
